Class Point

java.lang.Object
  Point

public class Point
extends java.lang.Object

Class Point. A point representing a location in (x, y) coordinate space, specified in integer precision.

Constructor Summary
Point(int x, int y)
          Constructs and initializes a new point with the specified x, y coordinates.
Point(Point other)
          Copy constructor, constructs and initializes a point with the same location as the specified Point object.

          Returns the Y coordinate of the point.

          Determines whether or not this Point is above the instance of Point it is to be compared with.

          Determines whether or not this Point is to the left of the instance of Point it is to be compared with.
 boolean isRight(Point other)
          Determines whether or not this Point is to the right of the instance of Point it is to be compared with.

Method Detail

distance

public double distance(Point p)
Calculates the distance between two points.

Parameters:
p - an object whose distance from this Point is to be calculated
Returns:
the distance between this Point and the object Point which was passed as a parameter

equals

public boolean equals(Point other)
Determines whether or not two points are equal. Two instances of Point are equal if the values of their x and y member fields, representing their position in the coordinate space, are the same.

Parameters:
other - an object to be compared with this Point
Returns:
true if the object to be compared is an instance of Point and has the same values; false otherwise

move

public void move(int dX,
                 int dY)
Moves the current point , at location (x,y) to a new location. This new location is determined by deltaX which changes X's position along the X axis and deltaY which changes Y's position along the Y axis.

Parameters:
deltaX - the distance to move the current point along the X axis
deltaY - the distance to move the current point along the Y axis

setX

public void setX(int x)
Sets the X coordinate of the point.

Parameters:
X - a new value for the X coordinate

setY

public void setY(int y)
Sets the Y coordinate of the point.

Parameters:
Y - a new value for the Y coordinate

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this point and its location in the (x, y) coordinate space.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string representation of this point; for example : (1,2)
